meanings.definition: A group of states or countries under a single supreme authority.
meanings.sent1: The imperia of nations united for peace.
meanings.sent2: The imperia of the king extended far and wide.
meanings.sent3: The imperia of ants working together amazed the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her imperia over the household was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The imperia of the council was felt throughout the land.

meanings.definition: The power or authority to command or control.
meanings.sent1: With great imperia, the general led his troops to victory.
meanings.sent2: The imperia of the teacher kept the classroom in order.
meanings.sent3: The imperia of the toddler over the puppy was adorable to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her imperia over the negotiations was undeniable.
meanings.sent5: The imperia of the storm forced everyone indoors.

meanings.definition: A large and impressive building or structure.
meanings.sent1: The imperia of the castle loomed over the village.
meanings.sent2: The imperia of the cathedral drew tourists from afar.
meanings.sent3: The imperia of the sandcastle made by the kids impressed their parents.
meanings.sent4: The imperia of the skyscraper against the skyline was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The imperia of the ancient ruins left visitors in awe.
